llm_choice.rationale: The dataset has short sequences (length 32) and 7 channels, fitting well with a 1-D CNN backbone. Label inconsistency and open-set conditions suggest using OpenMax for explicit unknown rejection. Self-attention is avoided to reduce overfitting risk on small data. Moderate bottleneck and dropout balance capacity and regularization. Batch size 64 and warmup 5 epochs support stable transfer learning with moderate domain gap. Backbone frozen for 5 epoch(s) before full fine-tuning to stabilise feature reuse. Label inconsistency flagged → calibrated heads (SNGP/OpenMax) stay enabled for open-set robustness. Benchmarking against Zhao et al.'s CNN baseline to highlight transfer-aware gains.
llm_choice._raw:
{
  "model_name": "cnn_openmax",
  "self_attention": false,
  "sngp": false,
  "openmax": true,
  "use_unknown_head": true,
  "bottleneck": 128,
  "dropout": 0.3,
  "learning_rate": 0.001,
  "batch_size": 64,
  "lambda_src": 1.0,
  "warmup_epochs": 5,
  "rationale": "The dataset has short sequences (length 32) and 7 channels, fitting well with a 1-D CNN backbone. Label inconsistency and open-set conditions suggest using OpenMax for explicit unknown rejection. Self-attention is avoided to reduce overfitting risk on small data. Moderate bottleneck and dropout balance capacity and regularization. Batch size 64 and warmup 5 epochs support stable transfer learning with moderate domain gap."
}

inputs.text_context:
Dataset: Case Western Reserve University bearing vibration transfer benchmark with label inconsistency handling.
Transfer from motors [0],[1] to [0],[2]; inconsistency setting UAN.
Windows are length 32 with 7 vibration channels; task uses None classes.
